comment: I took her online and I thought it was pretty easy. She doesn't grade hard so I'd take her again.

Literally just stay away if you want to pass. Quizzes and test are impossible and are taken with a webcam. If you get stuck with this teacher good luck getting a response from her. Worst decision ever.

I really enjoyed hospitality and tourism marketing! Some of the quizzes can be a little difficult, but as long as you have a general understanding of basic marketing concepts, you'll be fine. Utilize all of your resources and not just the powerpoints and you'll do fine. Super easy grader for written assignments!

This class was a breeze. As long as you submit your work on time and put in some effort, you will get an A! I'm not sure why she has a low rating on here, because this class was not difficult at all and it was a lot of fun if you're interested in the entertainment industry.

This class is overwhelmed with work that you don't have time to absorb the information and actually learn. Beginning of semester D2L and syllabus did not match on dates therefore I failed the first quiz. Doesn't respond efficiently. Creates unclear instructions and adds stress.

Follow directions for discussions and put in effort & you will get As. Quizzes are easy - powerpoints are most helpful for these. Assignments aren't bad, just prepare ahead of time. Overall very easy if you stay on top of things.

All of her quizzes use webcam & are over 2-3 chapters worth of mktg (not h&t) vocab. She expects memorization & will offer several synonyms in the answers. Expect to teach yourself. All of the quizzes are also scheduled during maintenance on D2L. She doesn't have her own materials. Post your discussions early or you won't get a good grade.

I have received points off for things listed in obscure documents but not the actual rubric on multiple occasions making it hard to determine what she wants and how she grades. Her quizzes, however, can be aced with little more than common sense, a B in this class is easy, an A is impossible do to her lack of rubric.

The overall class isn't hard, just boring. You have discussions, cases, and quizzes over chapters, and a semester long project. The project is boring and tedious and doesn't teach you anything. The professor never responds to emails, and overall instructions are unclear for an online class. Wouldn't recommend honestly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Very insightful professor. No tests, just a few online quizzes. A couple of short individual projects and a group project. For our class, it seemed like she ran out of things for us to do and made up a group project for us to complete the week of finals. Doesn't not respond quickly to emails.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Dr. Lester's teaching style is bland. A lot of her lectures are boring, but she really tries to get the class involved in a group discussion. Her assignments are disorganized and not very clear with directions, but she's a relatively lenient grader so just follow the rubrics the best you can. Not a terrible choice to take her for an elective.

Enjoyed her class. A decent amount of work but nothing outrageous. Class was more geared to how the concepts were effecting the real world. She has lots of real world experience and is passionate about the subject. Will be taking her in the summer as well for another class.

her directions are super confusing for an online class!! she doesnt help clarify at all. dont bother asking for clarification she acts like she's sooo busy to answer emails n when she does rarely u get a one word reply! class was very easy but you have to read cos shes petty with those quizzes she gives. overall easy class difficult professor!

Lester is a nice professor, but she clearly has no interest in teaching her students. She has multiple guest speakers and rarely discusses the material we will be tested on during class. We were given more busy work than I've ever had in college. All 20 chapter's review questions, 20 quizzes, and 5 critical thinking questions. Wouldn't recommend.

Fun class but she is so unorganized that learning is not possible. Her tests reflect nothing you learn and the book's chapters are so long and boring it's hard to learn from. She does give out a study guide but it's so long that once you fill it out you are taking the test. So it's not a great study tool.

Dr. Lester's Hospitality and Tourism class was very interesting and fairly easy.  I highly recommend her as a professor.  She brought in guest speakers everyday, students led discussions most of the time, and the classes went by fast.  Her busy work isn't bad at all, and the tests are manageable.

Absolutely worthless teacher. I was really excited to take this class and learned nothing. She doesn't lecture on the material AT ALL so class is pointless to go to....her semester long project was so poorly organized I'm not sure she even knew what was going on. Tried to email her with questions and was never written back. STAY AWAY.

Our class spent too much time on un-useful projects and her discussions rarely went to the chapters. Make sure you buy the book and study for her tests. She isn't very organized and left the class feeling stressed about projects and due dates.
Fairly easy class but very unorganized.

Good Prof, but you have to attend class. You need to get in a good group, if not you will not do well in the class. instead of test she does quizes on each chapter. attend all classes and you will be good!

No textbook. No tests! The entire class was the group although we were segmented at times to perform various tasks.  Come to class, participate, do the tasks you sign up for (giving it your best effort) and you should have no problem passing this class.  Prof. is very approachable, professional, open-minded, and flexible. Have fun!

I was really looking forward to this class.  Like the other post, too much time spent on stupid projects.  Never lectured on material, and test were very hard.  The only way to pass is to do all the projects very well.

Sports marketing was my most dissapointing class at KSU. You spend lots of class time on goofy games that groups must develop for a grade, and lectures are never on topic. It's pretty clear that she doesn't have a great depth of knowledge about the sports industry, and the textbook is inferior to others in the field. Tests are totally random.
